poem:
Title: "Sanctum Scorned"

His smile, a frost upon Faith's nectar,
Eyes, sharp as unholy knives,
Powers pontifical, edged with madness.
In the Vatican's shadowy chambers,
A child's laughter ebbs, forlorn,
Echoing through the crossed hallways-
Silent, save for the cold whispers 
Of a sin wrapped in sacred robes.
Thus, religion sits, a tragic mime,
Choking on its divine duplicity.
